definitions: geographical area at the edge of settled or developed territory
domain of activity not yet fully explored or developed
examples: The American frontier moved westward throughout the nineteenth century
Settlers crossed the frontier seeking new opportunities and land
Space exploration represents the final frontier for humanity
Scientists push the frontiers of medical research every day

definitions: person who lives or works on the frontier of civilization
examples: The frontiersman built his cabin miles from the nearest town
Daniel Boone became a legendary frontiersman in American history

definitions: decorative illustration facing the title page of a book
principal face or decorated entrance of a building
examples: The frontispiece depicted the author in his study
This rare edition features a hand-colored frontispiece
The cathedral's frontispiece showcases intricate Gothic stonework
Restoration of the frontispiece took nearly two years

definitions: thin layer of ice crystals formed on surfaces in cold weather
state or period of freezing weather conditions
examples: Morning frost covered the windshield in delicate patterns
The gardener protected plants from the overnight frost
The first frost usually arrives in late October
Heavy frost damaged the citrus crop this year

definitions: injury to body tissues caused by exposure to extreme cold
examples: The mountaineer suffered frostbite on three fingers
Severe frostbite can lead to permanent tissue damage

definitions: mass of small bubbles formed on or in liquid
light or insubstantial talk, ideas, or activities
examples: The cappuccino had perfect froth on top
Waves created white froth against the rocky shore
His speech was mostly froth with little substance
The article was froth designed to fill newspaper space

definitions: simple sugar found naturally in fruits and honey
examples: Fructose gives fruits their sweet taste naturally
High fructose corn syrup contains processed fructose

definitions: quality of being careful with money and avoiding waste
examples: Her frugality allowed her to retire early
The family practiced frugality during the economic downturn

definitions: sweet fleshy product of a plant containing seeds
result or reward of work or activity
examples: Fresh fruit provides essential vitamins and fiber
The market sells tropical fruit year-round
Years of research finally bore fruit
The fruits of their labor became evident

definitions: point at which a plan or project becomes successful
examples: The project came to fruition after years of planning
Her dreams finally reached fruition with the gallery opening

definitions: feeling of anger or annoyance from being unable to achieve something
prevention of progress, success, or fulfillment of something
examples: His frustration grew as the computer continued crashing
She expressed frustration with the slow bureaucratic process
The frustration of their plans led to abandoning the project
Weather caused frustration of the rescue attempts

definitions: recently hatched fish, especially in large numbers
examples: The salmon fry swim in shallow protected waters
Thousands of fry were released into the river

definitions: kitchen appliance or pan used for deep frying food
young chicken suitable for frying rather than roasting
examples: The deep fryer maintains oil at the perfect temperature
She bought an air fryer for healthier cooking
The fryer chickens weighed about three pounds each
These fryers are more tender than roasting chickens

definitions: process of cooking food in hot fat or oil
examples: The smell of bacon frying filled the kitchen
Frying requires careful temperature control for best results

definitions: ornamental shrub with drooping tubular flowers in red and purple
vivid purplish-red color resembling the flower
examples: The fuchsia bloomed profusely in the hanging basket
Hummingbirds are attracted to fuchsia flowers
She wore a stunning fuchsia dress to the gala
The sunset turned the clouds fuchsia and gold

definitions: act of sexual intercourse considered in vulgar terms
vulgar term used to express anger, contempt, or emphasis
examples: The crude graffiti contained profane sexual references
Such vulgar language violates workplace policies
His angry outburst shocked everyone in the meeting
The frustrated driver shouted at the traffic

definitions: soft candy made from sugar, butter, milk, and chocolate
deliberately ambiguous or vague statement to avoid commitment
examples: Homemade chocolate fudge melted in your mouth
The candy shop sells fudge in fifteen flavors
Politicians often fudge their answers to difficult questions
The report fudged the numbers to look better

definitions: material burned to produce heat or power
something that sustains or encourages an activity or emotion
examples: The car runs on unleaded fuel efficiently
Rising fuel costs affected transportation businesses significantly
Rumors added fuel to the controversy
Success fueled her ambition for greater achievements

definitions: act of providing fuel to a vehicle or system
examples: Aircraft fueling requires strict safety protocols
The fueling station serves hundreds of vehicles daily

definitions: British spelling of providing fuel to vehicles or systems
examples: The fuelling depot operates around the clock
Fuelling procedures must follow environmental regulations

definitions: person who has escaped from captivity or is in hiding
examples: The fugitive evaded capture for three months
Police issued alerts for the dangerous fugitive

definitions: contrapuntal composition where themes are introduced and developed by voices
dissociative state with loss of awareness of one's identity
examples: Bach composed masterful fugues for organ
The fugue features intricate interweaving melodic lines
The patient experienced a fugue state after trauma
During the fugue, he traveled miles with no memory

definitions: point on which a lever rests or is supported when lifting
thing that plays a central or essential role in activity
examples: The fulcrum must be positioned correctly for maximum leverage
Moving the fulcrum closer increased the lifting force
Trust serves as the fulcrum of their relationship
The treaty became the fulcrum of regional stability

definitions: feeling of happiness and satisfaction from achieving something
achievement of something desired, promised, or predicted
examples: She found fulfillment in teaching young children
Personal fulfillment comes from pursuing meaningful goals
Order fulfillment happens within twenty-four hours
The fulfillment of the prophecy amazed everyone

definitions: British spelling of satisfaction from achieving something meaningful
British spelling of achievement of something desired or promised
examples: Career fulfilment requires aligning work with values
She achieved fulfilment through volunteer work
The fulfilment center processes thousands of orders
Contract fulfilment remains our top priority

definitions: state of containing as much as possible or needed
examples: The restaurant reached full capacity by seven o'clock
He lived life to the full without regrets

definitions: defensive player positioned behind the main line in various football codes
examples: The fullback scored from thirty yards out
Their fullback excels at both defending and attacking

definitions: blacksmith's tool for grooving or spreading iron
person who cleans and thickens freshly woven cloth
examples: The blacksmith used a fuller to create the sword's blood groove
A fuller helps distribute weight in the blade
The fuller worked the wool until it became thick felt
Medieval fullers used special clay in their process

definitions: awkward attempt to hold, move, or find something
loss of possession of the ball in American football
examples: His nervous fumble with the keys delayed their escape
She made a fumble while reaching for her phone
The quarterback's fumble cost them the game
They recovered the fumble on their own twenty-yard line

definitions: gas, smoke, or vapor that smells strongly or is dangerous
examples: Toxic fumes from the chemical spill evacuated the building
Paint fumes require proper ventilation for safety

definitions: enjoyment, amusement, or lighthearted pleasure from an activity
examples: The children had fun at the amusement park
Learning becomes easier when it involves fun

definitions: practical use or purpose that something serves
large formal social event or ceremony
mathematical relationship between input and output values
examples: The main function of the liver is filtering blood
Each component serves a specific function in the system
The charity function raised thousands for cancer research
Formal dress is required for the diplomatic function
This exponential function models population growth accurately
The function maps each input to exactly one output

definitions: principle that design should be determined by practical function
theory that society's parts work together to promote solidarity
examples: Bauhaus architecture exemplified functionalism in building design
Functionalism rejected purely decorative architectural elements
Functionalism views institutions as serving social needs
Durkheim's functionalism influenced modern sociology significantly

definitions: person who advocates functional design over ornamentation
sociologist who analyzes society through functional relationships
examples: The functionalist architect prioritized utility over decoration
Functionalists revolutionized twentieth-century furniture design
Functionalist sociologists study how institutions maintain social order
As a functionalist, she examined religion's social role

definitions: quality of being suited to serve a purpose well through features
examples: The software's functionality improved with each update
Users value functionality over aesthetic design features

definitions: official who performs duties in government or organization
examples: Government functionaries processed thousands of visa applications
The functionary had limited decision-making authority

definitions: way in which something operates or works
examples: Regular maintenance ensures proper functioning of equipment
The functioning of democracy requires informed citizens

definitions: sum of money saved or available for a particular purpose
investment product pooling money from multiple investors
examples: The emergency fund covered unexpected medical expenses
They established a fund for their children's education
The mutual fund performed well despite market volatility
Her retirement fund includes diverse investment options

definitions: central or primary rule on which something is based
examples: Understanding fundamentals is essential before advancing
The fundamentals of democracy include free speech

definitions: strict maintenance of traditional orthodox religious or political doctrines
examples: Religious fundamentalism opposes modern secular values
Market fundamentalism advocates minimal government intervention

definitions: person who believes in strict literal interpretation of religious texts
examples: The fundamentalist preacher rejected evolutionary theory
Fundamentalists organized protests against the legislation

definitions: money provided for a particular purpose by an organization
examples: Research funding came from government grants
The startup secured funding from venture capitalists

definitions: event held to collect money for a cause
person who organizes campaigns to collect money for organizations
examples: The annual fundraiser supports local homeless shelters
Tonight's fundraiser features a silent auction
The professional fundraiser exceeded the campaign goal
She works as a fundraiser for the hospital

definitions: ceremony honoring a deceased person before burial or cremation
examples: The funeral brought together family from across the country
They held a simple funeral according to his wishes

definitions: fair consisting of rides, sideshows, and other amusements
examples: The summer funfair attracted thousands of visitors
Children enjoyed the funfair rides and games

definitions: chemical substance used to kill or prevent fungal growth
examples: Farmers applied fungicide to protect the wheat crop
This fungicide effectively controls powdery mildew

definitions: railway on steep slope with cars pulled by cables
examples: The funicular carries tourists up the mountainside
This historic funicular has operated since 1885

definitions: rhythmic musical genre combining soul, jazz, and R&B elements
state of depression or fear
examples: James Brown pioneered funk music in the 1960s
The band plays classic funk with modern influences
She fell into a funk after losing her job
He needs something to pull him out of this funk

definitions: cone-shaped utensil for pouring liquid into containers
rotating cone of wind in a tornado or waterspout
examples: Use a funnel to pour oil without spilling
The plastic funnel fits perfectly in the bottle neck
The funnel cloud touched down near the farmhouse
Witnesses reported seeing a funnel forming overhead

definitions: quality of being amusing or causing laughter
examples: The funny in his stories comes from everyday observations
She has a natural funny that lights up any room
